data.title: Good and fresh
data.text: Very good meal and you could tell the ingredients were fresh. I'd definitely recommend to out of towners looking for a place to eat.

data.title: Quick drink
data.text: We stopped here for a quick drink while we were wandering the City. Great bartenders! Great selection of local beers.

data.title: Probably the great adventure in cheese fries you'll ever have
data.text: Does Raleigh times have awesome food? YES. I can honestly say I've never had anything bad from the burgers to the fish tacos. However, my most favorite item that the Raleigh Times creates are their cheese-covered cheese fries. Utter perfection. Local ingredients and potatoes so fresh and crispy you're okay with the impact the carbs will have on your backside. They're that good.

data.title: Beers lunch
data.text:
Nice outdoor seating and good service. 
Good beer selection with local beers. Good appetizer list and food.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: Service was good, food was average, I'm sure there are better restaurants in downtown.  Locals seemed to like it though.

data.title: Great Place to land and relax on a weekend Downtown day
data.text: International Bluegrass Festival in Ral so the whole DT area crazy.  An oasis on the top floor of Raleigh Times.  Our server (wish I knew his name but red hair and beard, tall and thin) did an amazing job with 10 tables on the roof that changed quickly.  RT wisely limited the menu as there were SOOOO many in town, but the food did not dissappoint.  Bar eats were fantastic, service fantastic and an outside seat in the shade was just perfect.  Was allowed to taste a couple of beers to decide and even though we only ordered apps, was not rushed or did not feel like we ever had to leave though there were others waiting.  Perfect Sat afternoon place.

data.title: Great food, variety and atmosphere inside and outside.
data.text: Several co-workers have met here after work and recommended RT. Good for a date night also. Consistent with their really good food and service.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Historic building in downtown.  You can dine on the first or second floor.  On the second floor is an entrance to the rooftop where you can also dine.  There is usually some sort of band playing on the second floor.  There are bars on the first and second floor.  After we ate our dinner we went out onto the rooftop.  What a view.  It was a beautiful night.  Went there twice in a week.  Will definitely go back when I am in town again.

data.title: Good Food and Beer in Historical Setting
data.text: We sat on the rooftop, overlooking the city, for lunch - I recommend it. The food was really good and the craft beer offerings were extensive. The service was excellent. The building is very unique and has 4 separate bars in it (at least), giving the place a great atmosphere.

data.title: Great Historical Place For Dinner & Drinks
data.text:
It is so hot outside, 91F (33C), and humid that I needed something cold to drink.  I am having a local Lagunitas beer.  It is is actually quite good.

Raleigh Times Bar is in the old Raleigh Time Newspaper building.  It is a local historical landmark.

This a very interesting place.  I am sure you would enjoy both dinner and drinks when you are in Raleigh eating inside or outside.

data.title: Good sangria's
data.text: Went on a Saturday afternoon with out of town friends. Enjoyed some pretty good sangria. Friendly bartender made it fresh right in front of us. Won't buy/drink if a mix or "pre made". Friends enjoyed bar good too.  Nice history of Raleigh Times. Building approximately 100 yrs old. Capital city small, but nice and very walkable.

data.title: Good food & Good vibe
data.text: The watermelon salad was a fresh take on light summer fare and the shrimp & grits were flavorful (although a little heavy on the onions - uh!). The waiter was pleasant and checked on us several times even during the height of lunch hour. Very pleasant experience and the throwback decor was welcoming.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: We found this place by accident, we were not disappointed. Great food and drinks! Great atmosphere! Helpful staff.

data.title: Chinashop53
data.text: Oatmeal and other breakfast items, Chocolate Chip Mini Loaf very tasty. Outside tables as well as inside and upststairs tables to eat at. Coffee and specialty both very nice. Was very busy with College students and locals at nine am. With out a doubt good choice to stop.

data.title: Erstwhile journalist treated to a blast from the past
data.text: Repurposed 1906 Times newspaper office boasts original floor boards, open ceiling, while patrons may choose from local beers on tap, quick and tasty eats.

data.title: Bachlorette Party Stop!
data.text: Did the peddle wagon and this was our first stop on a Wednesday night and it was not crowded. There were 9 of us and we were greeted by the rudest bar tender ever!  He had zero personality and was not happy to take our orders or accommodate our group!  Will NEVER go back.  We did not order food... However we were there for a quick drink and the red headed bar tender showed NO southern hospitality!

data.title: Cool place, great service, and the food rocks! Did I mention the beer? Wow!
data.text: This is a must if you like beer and good food with a place with a cool vibe. The location is the old Raleigh times location. Rooftop bar and 3 on the main level. Come for the food stay for the party.

data.title: Great Beer!
data.text: This is an excellent place to try different beer or cocktails. The beer menu changes depending on the season. I'm not a big beer drinker but I had a Chai beer that was excellent!!! The food was really good as well.

data.title: Horrible service
data.text:
Our first visit, will sadly be our last.  Came in at 1:30a.m. to eat Friday night.  Asked upon our arrival if they were still serving food.  The answer was an affirmative.  We quickly ordered their deviled eggs, while we perused the menu.  We got them shortly thereafter and they were heavy on the chives to the extent they were almost offensive.  We ordered our sandwiches.  At 1:45a.m. we were asked to pay for our bill!  WE HAD NOT received our food yet, besides the deviled eggs and our sodas!!!  Paying for the bill before the meal is expected at McDonald's but certainly wasn't at this place.  That was beyond off-putting!!!  It's whatever though.  At 1:50a.m. the bouncer (or whomever) came up to us and told us, "guys you gotta wrap things up in the next 10 minutes".  WE HAD NOT GOTTEN OUR PURCHASED FOOD YET THAT WE PLANNED ON EATING THERE!!!  Clearly they were more concerned with leaving their jobs than us!  We cancelled the food we still hadn't received and demanded our money back and left.  

You may have superb food but unfortunately we will never know.  When you treat your customers the way you treated us, it doesn't matter how incredible your food is, I assure you we will never return.

data.title: Loved the Street Tacos
data.text: A friend and I went to Raleigh Times after a concert at the Red Hat Amphitheater. (We're out-of-towners.) The street tacos, unique brews (they have an awesome beer selection) and service were excellent.
